line_1: To myself will my image reflect,
What River will her Smiles reflect,
line_2: Now that no Beams thou can'st direct?
And yet 'tis fear'd, there's Reason to suspect

line_1: The image of thy genius can reflect?
line_2: To shew thee in thy native glories deckt.

line_1: The bearer of the cup did now reflect
line_2: On his past danger, and his base neglect;

line_1: If the great Mourner would reflect,
line_2: Yet ought his Sorrow to be checkt;

line_1: Than Those which all His num'rous Crowns reflect:
line_2: His Head with brighter Beams fair Virtue deck't,

line_1: I on the patient Socrates reflect;
line_2: When I am wrong'd, or treated with Neglect,

line_1: And now one Moment able to reflect,
line_2: I found the King abandon'd to Neglect,

line_1: And now one Moment able to reflect,
line_2: Seen without Awe, and serv'd without Respect.

line_1: Deep by regret each happy scene reflect,
line_2: For her my life all other joys neglect.
On all the riches, and respect,

line_1: And unctuous splendours from their robes reflect:
line_2: In turgid pomp their strutting limbs are deck'd,
